topics.body:
So apparently conservatives were actually right about the slippery slope argument against gay rights.  I don't mean that as the end of the world doomsaying they've been spouting off for the last fifty years, but rather how people view the court system and how they want the court system in the usa to function has fundamentally changed the last ten years.

How people used to view how the supreme court was "supposed" to function summarized in a sentence, "You go to hell!  You go to hell and you die!"
How people now view the supreme court, "If it's not constitutional and the law doesn't make sense or have rational to them then get the fuck out!"


What I mean by this is that while more americans count themselves as conservative american views have massively shifted to being against morality laws that are either unconstitutional or don't have actual justification.

. . . . . And they call this a bad thing again why?
